p: The morphology and structure of SARS-CoV-2 has important implications for waste and wastewater services. Each SARS-CoV-2 virion is a small spherical particle (≈100 nm diameter), consisting of a positive-sense single stranded RNA genome within a fragile lipid envelope [ 12]. It is a betacoronavirus in the subgenus Sarbecovirus. Although sometimes referred to as “a type of flu”, it is in fact genetically and virologically distinct from influenza viruses as these are negative-sense RNA viruses.
